info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 7:32PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong shifting winds with heavy snow at times this evening across Southwest Montana... At 720 pm...a strong cold front moving through Southwest Montana is shifting gusty southerly winds more northerly, and bringing snow, which has been heavy at times in the Whitehall, Bozeman, Townsend, and Dillon areas. These conditions will likely move into the Ennis and West Yellowstone areas through 830 pm. Additional snowfall amounts through this time will mostly range from around one inch in the valleys to up to 3 inches in the mountains. Winds have been gusting in excess of 40 mph ahead of and in the wake the cold front, which have caused visibilities to fall below one mile at times. With roads becoming icy and snow covered with the passage of the front, in addition to the winds and reduced visibility, travel will be very difficult, so use caution out on the roads this evening.
